tagref.name: Area Of Effect Behavior Equipment
tagref.tooltip: if a reference is here, area of effect damage will attach the equipment to the target

bit.name: Area Damage Players Only
bit.tooltip: area of effect damage only affects players

bit.name: Affects Model Targets
bit.tooltip: distribute the damage amongst the model targets. this is the default behavior for aoe damage, but can be set here for direct damage.

option.name: Default
option.tooltip: uses code to figure out what vocalization to use

bit.name: Ignore Seat Scale For Direct Damage
Forces Hard Ping If Body Damage
Area Of Effect Skip Obstruction Test
Does Not Cause Biped Area Of Effect Effect
Apply Tree Of Life
bit.tooltip: as if a tree of life was near 'victim'

bit.name: Causes Incineration Dissolve To Dead Units
Force Hard Ping As Attachment Feedback
bit.tooltip: force a hard ping as a notification to the player that the sticky grenade has attached

float32.name: Headshot Damage Multiplier
float32.tooltip: ignored if zero or if headshot flag is not set above; otherwise, makes headshot not instantly lethal, but multiplies damage done to head by this much. 2 does 2x damage to head for headshot. note that head still has different health than body.

float32.name: Area Of Effect Core Radius
float32.tooltip: if >0 then higher fidelity obstruction collision checks are performed. This field has no other ramifications.

float32.name: Active Camoflage Damage
float32.tooltip: how much more visible this damage makes a player who is active camouflaged

float32.name: Stun
float32.tooltip: amount of stun added to damaged unit

float32.name: Maximum Stun
float32.tooltip: damaged unit's stun will never exceed this amount

float32.name: Stun Time
float32.tooltip: duration of stun due to this damage

int32.name: Damage Stun
int32.tooltip: how long we stun recovering current body damage

float32.name: Alternate Instantaneous Acceleration
float32.tooltip: This field can be used for an alternative acceleration if the corresponding flags are set, e.g. check vehicle->flags.vehicle wants reduced weapon impulse when airborne

float32.name: Acceleration Cap
float32.tooltip: set to zero to disable cap

float32.name: Soft Ping Pain Screen Scale
float32.tooltip: The maximum amount to apply the pain screen pose overlay

stringid.name: Custom Label
stringid.tooltip: label used to control what damage response will fire.

float32.name: Area Of Effect Spike Damage Bump

int32.name: Stasis Time
int32.tooltip: duration of stasis due to this damage, zero disables

float32.name: Tree of Life Shield Regen Modifier
float32.tooltip: regen velocity of TOL: if non-1.0 this overrides any 'shield recharge rate' trait

float32.name: Minimum Shield Level
float32.tooltip: when hit, shield will be reset to this percentage of full strength if it is below

float32.name: Shield Stun Time
float32.tooltip: time after damage applied before shield recharges

float32.name: Minimum Health Level
float32.tooltip: when hit, health will be reset to this percentage of full health if it is below

float32.name: Health Stun Time
float32.tooltip: time after damage applied before health recharges

float32.name: Minimum Energy Level
float32.tooltip: like above, TOL reset minimum equipment energy to this

float32.name: Equipment Stun Time
float32.tooltip: time after damage applied before equipment recharges

comment.title: Modifies TOL Logic So That (Above) Unstun Will Only Happen If (Below) Minimum Stun Time Has Passed

plugin.comment:
Controls particle velocities when a damage effect shatters a materal.
All particles created within 'forward radius' will be kicked along the damage direction with a speed equivalent to 'forward velocity' at the epicenter of the damage and 0 at the outer radius. 'Forward exponent' is used to modify the velocity scale. A low exponent (like 0.5) means that particles between the epicenter and the radius will be kicked out with a speed closer to 'forward velocity' than if a higher exponent (like 2.0) was used
The outward fields work in a similar way, except instead of kicking along the damage direction, they get kick away from the damage epicenter.
